content.question: Which of the following describes a negative effect of substituting hydrofluorocarbons (<math alttext="H C F Cs" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>HCFCs</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>) for chlorofluorocarbons (<math alttext="C F Cs" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>CFCs</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>) in an effort to reduce ozone depletion?

choices.label: Hydrofluorocarbons are prohibitively expensive to produce and are not widely used in industry.
Some type of hydrofluorocarbons are greenhouse gases that contribute to global climate change.

Hydrofluorocarbons can interact with <math alttext="N O x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>NOx</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="V O Cs" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>VOCs</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> in the troposphere to produce photochemical smog.
High levels of hydrofluorocarbons in the stratosphere can lead to physiological stress and decreased growth in plants.

content.answer: Some type of hydrofluorocarbons are greenhouse gases that contribute to global climate change.
